bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
======
The need for speeding up the Hardware Certification process.

Consequence:
============
Spend much time on OS installation.

Fix:
====
Provide pre-configured kickstart files to speed up or to automate the OS installation.

Result:
=======
The OS installation will no longer consume much time by utilizing those pre-configured kickstart files.

Add the checking for connected displays.

Result:
=======
If there's no connected displays, the VIDEO test will report the correct error message.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
======
a fake device was needed in early HTS revisions, but isn't any longer in V7. It causes the exception because the code that adds it has no "class" property.  

Consequence:
============
fake "Computer" device causing KeyError

Fix:
====
remove fake "Computer" device

Result:
=======
no more traceback error caused by this

=======
v7 will obsolete hts

bugs.creator: Rob Landry
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
======
fv_* tests requires the local fv image.

Consequence:
============
fv_* tests will fail if the local fv image is not available.

Fix:
====
let the fv_* tests download the fv images from the parter ftp site if those fv images are not present locally.

Result:
=======
fv_* tests will try to download the fv images from the parter ftp site if those fv images are not present locally.
bugs.summary: fv_* tests should support multiple image options

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
======
there's a typo in fv_all, fv_network tests

Consequence:
============
fv_all, fv_network tests traceback

Fix:
====
fixed the typo in fv_network test.

Result:
=======
fv_all was removed from the test suite and fv_network test runs as expected.
bugs.summary: fv_all, fv_network test traceback

bugs.creator: Greg Nichols
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause:
======
v7 can not record the associated files from info an audio tests.

Consequence:
============
associated files from info an audio tests are missing.

Fix:
====
checks the test results directory for any additional files produced by the test, and base64-encodes them as <attachment> elements within the <run> element.  

Result:
=======
associated files from info an audio tests are embedded into the results.xml file.
bugs.summary: v7's results.xml testing database does not contain associated files from info an audio tests.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
In v7 1.3, reboot nfs test might fail to grab an IP address when kexec kernel is trying to dump vmcore to an NFS server due to link_delay value not set in kdump.conf. This issue has been fixed in v7 1.4, now kdump (originally reboot) test will set link_delay value to 60s to make sure kexec kernel can wait for enough time to obtain an IP address before dumping vmcore to NFS server. 

Note that if user has ever set link_delay value in kdump.conf, kdump test won't override it. So please make sure the value of link_delay is correct before running the test.
bugs.summary: Reboot nfs test does not reliably grab an ip address causing the test to fail

In RHEL 5/6 it appears this copy takes precedence over the version from python 2.6. So this copy should not be installed by v7 on both RHEL 5 and 6, as python provides it. In v7 1.4, the decimal module has been removed from v7 source code.

Fix:

v7/kdump test no longer fails.

bugs.creator: George Beshers
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 

clocktest part of CORE test is not completely correct

Consequence: 

CORE test will fail on very large systems (e.g.: 2048cpus)

Fix: 

clocktest is fixed

Result: 

CORE test will not fail anymore
bugs.summary: clocktest use of CPUSET_S not completely correct.

bugs.creator: George Beshers
bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 

the old CORE test in essence calculates jitter from the first to the last CPU

Consequence: 

the test doesn't allow for large CPU count.

Fix: 


The new version of CORE test changes the way jitter is calculated. now it calculates jitter between adjacent (in numbering) cpus.  It adds the adjacent jitter each pass, and divides it by the number of measurements (the number of cpus minus one). It sets the standard at 0.2 sec. jitter, for both the average, and the worst adjacent cpu measurement.

Result: 

the CORE test can give correct result on large CPU count.
bugs.summary: clocktest jitter test don't allow for large cpu count.

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: 

a system with >= 4TB memory which is outside of currently supported limits

Consequence: 

hwcert-client MEMORY test will fail.

Fix: 

new hwcert-client adds a verification step to the memory test to check swap on large systems (more than 4 TB system memory).   It checks that the there is swap greater than 2.5% of system memory to account for overhead.

Result: 

hwcert-client will give warning before certification continues.
bugs.summary: V7 memory test fails on systems with 4TB (outside of currently supported limits)

bugs.cf_release_notes:
Cause: kabi-whitelist was renamed in RHEL6.5 to kernel-abi-whitelist.  This package name changed is handled via yum and rpm with a %obsoletes and %provides kabi-whitelist to ensure the correct upgrade path works, however the hwcert-client test suite checks only the rpm name so it did not follow this.

Consequence:

All runs of the info test in the hwcert-client test suite will prompt the user that kabi-whitelist is not installed and ask if they want to attempt to install it.  This will always fail to install as the kabi-whitelist package has been replaced.  So the user will continue to receive this problem.  After pressing No the info test will properly review the abi when necessary and pass/fail correctly.

Fix: 

The runtime requires in the info test for the kabi-whitelist package name has been removed and a clear error message has been added when the whitelist cannot be located.

Result: 

Info runs that do not require the whitelist will work correctly and never prompt the user to install the whitelist package.  Info runs that require the whitelist but do not have it installed will inform the user that they need to install it and then fail the info test.  Info runs that require the whitelist but do have it installed will correctly perform the abi comparison and pass/fail as appropriate.
bugs.summary: hwcert-client tries to install kabi-whitelists for the info tests, but RHEL 6.5 renamed the package
